  "description": "At Atis Limited, our vision is to be the leading real estate consultancy in Nigeria. Delivering quality, strategic and Commercial solutions to occupiers and investors. Our values are Excellence, Integrity and Professionalism combined with energy and Innovation. We focus on development of a lasting business relationship that transcends in real estate transaction. Our priorities are the development of strategies and effective implementation of transactions to ensure that corporate objectives are met.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Ikoyi - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Identify reliable suppliers, negotiate contracts, and manage supplier relationships to maintain a strong network of quality suppliers.
	Conduct market research to find potential suppliers and evaluate their products, prices, and quality.
	Monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues related to delivery or product quality.
	Oversee the entire procurement process, from requisition to purchase order generation, ensuring compliance with company policies.
	Obtain and review quotes from suppliers, compare them, and prepare analysis reports for decision-making.
	Work with relevant departments to confirm purchase requirements and specifications.
	Negotiate pricing, terms, and conditions with suppliers to secure favorable terms and reduce costs without compromising on quality.
	Analyze market trends to anticipate shifts in pricing and availability and recommend adjustments to purchasing strategies.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities through supplier consolidation, volume discounts, or alternative sourcing.
	Conduct regular audits of procurement activities and maintain thorough documentation.
	Prepare reports on procurement activities, including cost analyses, vendor performance, and procurement cycle times.
	Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with inventory management teams to ensure optimal stock levels and avoid stockouts or overstocking.
	Track orders and deliveries, ensuring all items are received in good condition and on time.
	Work with logistics providers and internal teams to manage shipping, customs, and distribution of products.
	Prepare purchase orders, contracts, and maintain accurate procurement records in line with company policies.
	Present procurement reports and recommendations to senior management as required.
	Collaborate with other departments, such as accountto ensure seamless procurement and supply chain activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in procurement, supply chain, or a related field.
	Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM), Certified Purchasing Professional (CPP), or similar,(preferred but not required).
	Strongnegotiation skills and attention to detail and reliability.
	Proficiency in procurement software.
	Knowledge of supply chain and inventory management principles.
	High adaptability and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in office software (MS Office Suite, Google Workspace).
	Ability to handle sensitive information withdiscretion,confidentiality and professionalism.
	Project Management.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Pension
	HMO.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@atislimited.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.
	Proximity to Ikoyi will be a major advantage.

Procurement Officer Job at Atis Limited




        
    

        
        At Atis Limited, our vision is to be the leading real estate consultancy in Nigeria. Delivering quality, strategic and Commercial solutions to occupiers and investors. Our values are Excellence, Integrity and Professionalism combined with energy and Innovation. We focus on development of a lasting business relationship that transcends in real estate transaction. Our priorities are the development of strategies and effective implementation of transactions to ensure that corporate objectives are met.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Ikoyi - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Identify reliable suppliers, negotiate contracts, and manage supplier relationships to maintain a strong network of quality suppliers.
	Conduct market research to find potential suppliers and evaluate their products, prices, and quality.
	Monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues related to delivery or product quality.
	Oversee the entire procurement process, from requisition to purchase order generation, ensuring compliance with company policies.
	Obtain and review quotes from suppliers, compare them, and prepare analysis reports for decision-making.
	Work with relevant departments to confirm purchase requirements and specifications.
	Negotiate pricing, terms, and conditions with suppliers to secure favorable terms and reduce costs without compromising on quality.
	Analyze market trends to anticipate shifts in pricing and availability and recommend adjustments to purchasing strategies.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities through supplier consolidation, volume discounts, or alternative sourcing.
	Conduct regular audits of procurement activities and maintain thorough documentation.
	Prepare reports on procurement activities, including cost analyses, vendor performance, and procurement cycle times.
	Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with inventory management teams to ensure optimal stock levels and avoid stockouts or overstocking.
	Track orders and deliveries, ensuring all items are received in good condition and on time.
	Work with logistics providers and internal teams to manage shipping, customs, and distribution of products.
	Prepare purchase orders, contracts, and maintain accurate procurement records in line with company policies.
	Present procurement reports and recommendations to senior management as required.
	Collaborate with other departments, such as accountto ensure seamless procurement and supply chain activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in procurement, supply chain, or a related field.
	Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM), Certified Purchasing Professional (CPP), or similar,(preferred but not required).
	Strongnegotiation skills and attention to detail and reliability.
	Proficiency in procurement software.
	Knowledge of supply chain and inventory management principles.
	High adaptability and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in office software (MS Office Suite, Google Workspace).
	Ability to handle sensitive information withdiscretion,confidentiality and professionalism.
	Project Management.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Pension
	HMO.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@atislimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.
	Proximity to Ikoyi will be a major advantage.

Assistant Manager, HSE Job at CWAY Group




        
    

        
        CWAY Group is a multinational conglomerate, headquartered in Lagos state Nigeria. The sectorial investments is in emerging diverse businesses including Food and Beverages, Drinking Water and Snacks.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager, HSE

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description / Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Assist the HSE Manager in the development and implementation of safety policies and procedures.
	Conduct regular safety audits and inspections to ensure compliance with regulations.
	Identify and assess potential hazards in the workplace and recommend corrective actions.
	Develop and deliver training programs related to health, safety, and environmental practices.
	Monitor and report on HSE performance metrics and recommend improvements.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor's degree in Environmental Science, Occupational Health and Safety, Engineering or a related field.
	At least 5years of experience in a health, safety, and environmental role, preferably in the Food & Beverages industry.


Skills:


	Strong knowledge of HSE regulations and best practices.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to conduct training sessions and workshops effectively.
	Proficient in risk assessment techniques and hazard identification.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: northrecruit@cwaygroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

  "description": "Sky Mall is a family-friendly destination for entertainment, leisure and shopping, situated on Lekki-Epe Expressway in the Sangotedo axis of Lagos.
